creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: tan colored square of paper; six lines of calligraphy, with some cursive; first line is boldest; fifth line is half the length, and sixth line is only a few characters; a few bold, larger characters at far left (signature?); black ink mark going off page at ULC
title: Twenty-five Letters
